snippet: Voters, unionized or not, should recognize the new “right to work” push for what it is: bad economics and cynical politics.
abstract: Editorial notes that, following campaign against public workers, Republicans in statehouses around the United States are taking aim at private sector unions and claiming that unions reduce economic growth and jobs; asserts that voters across the country should recognize the legislative push for what it is, namely, bad economics and cynical politics.
lead_paragraph: Voters, unionized or not, should recognize the new “right to work” push for what it is: bad economics and cynical politics.
